results.summary: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 – ETSM2030
results.content: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 – ETSM2030

beneficiaryAdministration:
Submission process

Interested applicants, represented by legal representatives of tourism SMEs, are requested to apply online and answer all mandatory questions at: www.etsm2030.eu/apply link.

Questions on the application process can be addressed at: etsm2030@uibk.ac.at

 

How to apply

Who can apply - Eligibility Criteria

Any legal entity that fulfils the following conditions is allowed to submit its application for funding under the call:

1.1.  Be a small or medium-sized enterprise (SME) as defined by the EU recommendation 2003/3612;

In this sense, start-ups, micro, small and medium-sized enterprises, same as any other type of SME falling under this definition are eligible to apply to the call.

1.2.  Be registered in one of the participating EU-member countries of ETSM2030 partnership:

  • Austria, Germany, Italy, Poland, Romania, Slovenia.

1.3.  Be established for at least three financial years to be proved through the Company Registration Report;

1.4.  Work in tourism, i. e. belong to one of these categories of the tourism industry (NACE classes and categories):

  • H4910 — Passenger rail transport, interurban
  • H4932 — Taxi operation
  • H4939 — Other passenger land transport n.e.c.
  • H5010 — Sea and coastal passenger water transport
  • H5030 — Inland passenger water transport
  • H5110 — Passenger air transport
  • I5510 — Hotels and similar accommodation
  • I5520 — Holiday and other short-stay accommodation
  • I5530 — Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks
  • I5610 — Restaurants and mobile food service activities
  • I5630 — Beverage serving activities
  • N7710 — Renting and leasing of motor vehicles
  • N7721 — Renting and leasing of recreational and sports goods
  • N79 —    Travel agency, tour operator reservation service and related activities
  • N8230 – Organisation of conventions and trade shows
  • R90 —     Creative, arts and entertainment activities
  • R91 —     Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
  • R92 —     Gambling and betting activities
  • R93 —     Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities


It is also a prerequisite that the applicants fulfil the following criteria:

1.5.  Has not been declared bankrupt or has initiated bankruptcy procedures;

1.6.  Be not under liquidation; an enterprise under difficulty accordingly to the Commission Regulation No 651/2014 art. 2.18.

1.7.  Conducts activities that respect climate and environmental priorities of the EU and cause no significant harm to them [reference to EU horizontal principle].

 All applicants must apply individually. It is not permitted to propose projects in partnership with other SMTEs. Only one application per SMTE is accepted.

Applying SMTEs have to agree to the Declaration of Honor, where the applying SMTE has to declare that it is not in any of the above-mentioned situations. Selected SMTEs have to sign the Service Agreement which defines eligible activities for both parties within 3 weeks after acceptance notification. If a selected SMTE fails to sign the service agreement it will be put on the reserve list.

 

Application procedure

All applicants are requested to:

  • Apply online through the dedicated page (https://www.etsm2030.eu/). Applicants shall register on the platform to access the ETSM2030 call for proposals page and the application package.
  • Applying SMTEs have to fill in an application in the English language. Due to the fact that applicants would be non-native English speakers, the applications will not be evaluated based on the use of language but on the provided content. Please be clear and precise in the explanations provided in the project proposal.
  • Fill in the administrative and technical information requested in the online AF on the platform.
  • Complete the online application and submit all the documents requested. Applicants who fail to do so will not be considered admissible.

Proposals are admissible only if they meet the following criteria:

  • Only one application per applicant can be submitted for this Call for Proposals. In the case of submissions by the same applicant of different proposals or multiple submissions of the same proposal, only the last one received will enter the evaluation process; the rest will be declared as non-admissible.
  • Only proposals submitted before the deadline will be accepted. The deadline for this call is Wednesday 5 July 2023, at 17:00 CET (Brussels time).
  • Only complete proposals, including all the required information and documentation, will be accepted.
  • Only proposals submitted through the online submission form will be accepted. Paper/printed versions or hand-written versions submitted by post or other means will not be accepted.

The call for proposals will be open from Wednesday 3 May 2023 to Wednesday 5 July 2023 at 17:00 CET (Brussels time). Applications submitted after the deadline will not be accepted and will receive by return e-mail a "call closed" message. Potential applicants are invited not to wait until the last moment to apply. The time of receipt of the application, as recorded by the submission system, will be definite.

 

Evaluation and selection process

An independent Selection and Evaluation Committee will manage and supervise the process, ensuring fairness and transparency. The evaluators will generate a ranked list using the overall scores for each application.

The evaluation will happen in the following way:

  • Formal eligibility check of proposals
  • Technical evaluation with appointed experts
  • Selection procedure

 

Check for Proposal Eligibility

Before proposals are evaluated technically, their administrative eligibility is verified. Only eligible submissions will be evaluated. The eligibility criteria, as referred to in section 3 of the call text, will be applied to discard non-eligible proposals.

Non-eligible proposals will get a rejection letter with the proper decision justification.

 

Evaluation criteria

Eligible applications will be evaluated against predetermined evaluation criteria, applying predefined score points. These criteria are listed in section 4.2. of the call and will be applied to discard non- eligible proposals.

 The applicants will be requested to explain their sustainability monitoring needs/status quo in terms of:

  • sustainability practices,
  • willingness to implement cutting-edge developments,
  • ability to network with other stakeholders in their destinations and their influence on other members of the ecosystem.

Moreover, the applicants shall explain how the training and advisory support and joint international sustainable innovation projects (SIP) will meet their needs and will support them in the process of recovery after COVID-19.

For each criterion marks from 0–5 points are given, which means that the maximum score is 15 points. Those proposals which pass the threshold of 5 points are included in the further evaluation process while those with lower than 5 points are rejected. Although passing the threshold does not mean that the project will be funded. The ranking is separately listed for each individual territory.

 

Selection of the participating SMTEs

Applying SMTEs will be selected based on the scores achieved in the Evaluation Form. The selection committee consists of four industry experts and two scientific experts in sustainable management and monitoring. One of the four industry experts is located in the respective country of the SMTE.

Ranking of proposals based on SMTEs overall score: max. 15 points to achieve.

Six national rankings will be made to maintain the geographical variety of SMTEs. In case of the same SMTEs’ score and position in the ranking, the following priority rule will be used:

(1) the score in C2 Willingness to implement cutting-edge developments,

(2) the score in C3 Ability to network

and (3) the score in C1 Sustainability practices

One month after closing the call each applicant will be informed via e-mail of the (1) acceptance, (2) inclusion in the reserve ranking list or (3) rejection of the application Moreover, the name of selected SMTEs will be published at the ETSM2030 website.

For each country reserve ranking lists will be made in the case of any withdrawals reported by the selected SMTEs.
description:
ETSM2030 offers a bundle of eligible activities for which financial support is provided and direct services to the SMTEs provided by the project consortium. These tailored services will be delivered as follows:

Step 1 - Open Call: The application process for 84 SMTEs from 6 different countries starts.

Step 2 – Selection of SMTES: Our expert-team will select the participating SMTEs.

Step 3 – Assessment of the Status Quo: Asessing the current Status Quo of sustainability awareness, practices and monitoring within the SMTEs (see eligible activity 1, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 4 – Knowledge Improvement: With coachings and trainings about sustainability the SMTEs will improve their knowledge (see eligible activity 2, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 5 – Sustainability Monitoring Tools: SMTEs will develop a sustainability monitoring tool which is suitable for SMTEs and can easily be integrated in daily routines.

Step 6 – Sustainability Innovation Projects: Together with other SMTEs of ETSM2023 joint projects in the field of sustainability will be conducted (see eligible activity 3, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 7 – Application for Certification: SMTEs will develop and apply for a sustainability certification (see eligible activity, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 8 - SESTINE: The SESTINE is a network for fostering exchange between sustainable working SMTEs.
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
furtherInformation:
European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 - in short 'ETSM2030' - is a project co-funded by the European Union under the Single Market Programme, supporting the sustainability activity of European small and medium-sized tourism enterprises. The Call for Proposals sets out the rules for submission and selection of third parties (SMTEs) that will receive financial support under the project.

The project is run by the international consortium created by the following partners representing six European countries:

  • University of Innsbruck (Austria),
  • IMC Krems (Austria),
  • Centre of Business Excellence (CBE) (Slovenia),
  • Eurac Research (Italy),
  • Poznań University of Economics and Business (Poland),
  • RoMontana, National Association for Rural and Mountain Development (Romania),
  • TourCert (Germany),
  • and TVB Innsbruck (Austria).

 

Project objectives

Objective 1: Creating a long-term monitoring system for tourism SMTEs

Objective 2: Initiating effective mechanisms for best practice exchange

Objective 3: Fostering innovative solutions and creating awareness

Objective 4: Creating inter-regional digital eco-systems of sustainability innovation

Objective 5: Creating support for tourism SMTEs in developing their skills and capacities

 

What do we offer?

The selected SMEs go through four eligible activities for which they receive financial support in the form of lump sums in the amount of € 7.840,-. The eligible activities are:

  • Eligible Activity 1: sustainability monitoring
  • Eligible Activity 2: training/ coaching
  • Eligible Activity 3: sustainability innovations
  • Eligible Activity 4: certification application

 

For further information see section 2.3. in the call.
caName: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 – ETSM2030
projectName: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030

results.summary: ECOTOURS - MSME’s support on circular tourism
results.content: ECOTOURS - MSME’s support on circular tourism

beneficiaryAdministration:
Interested Micro, Small and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) can apply online and answer all mandatory questions using the ECOTOURS Application Form link.

Applications are submitted by the MSMEs on the google platform which include questions related to the ECOTOURS programme and specific acknowledgment to the conditions of the project. The platform will be the only entry point for all applications.

Questions on the application process can be addressed at: ecotours@enoros.com.cy

The open call guidelines – including all details on the call and the project - can be downloaded using the following link: http://ecotours-project.eu

Evaluation process

The applications will be collected, analyzed and assessed by an Evaluation Committee composed at Country level by the ECOTOURS Consortium members. Applications will be sorted and selected following three main steps:

1.            Admissibility and Eligibility check

2.            Quality assessment

3.            Ranking and final selection

A two-step evaluation (1. Admissibility/Eligibility check and 2. Quality Assessment) will be carried out - in parallel in all countries involved - against the Eligibility criteria described in section 5 and the award criteria described in section 6.5 of the Guidelines. Finally, a third step will close the procedure with the ranking and final selection.

An application will be considered as eligible only if the applicant provides all information and completes all the required fields in the Application Form, and completes the Declaration of Honor. The applicant must follow the application process (see section 6.1 of the Guidelines) and submit the application before the deadline.

Admissibility and Eligibility check

An application will be eligible only is all the following eligibility criteria are met:

1 The applicant is a micro, small or medium enterprises (see section below “who can apply for further information on MSMEs definition); 

2. The applicant’s economic activity is in tourism or other activities that are demonstrating or aiming for innovation in tourism;

3. The applicant is located in one of the following eligible countries: Italy (IT); Greece (EL); France (FR); Hungary (HU); Spain (ES); Cyprus (CY).

4. The applicant is not a company undertaking in difficulty

5. The applicant complies with national and EU regulations, and it has not applied or received double funding.

6. The applicant submits a completed application within the deadline.

If the applicant discovers an error in the proposal previously submitted, and provided the call deadline has not passed, the applicant may re-submit the proposal (for this purpose contact ecotours@enoros.com.cy). However, ECOTOURS cannot guarantee resubmission will be done in time if requested less than 2 working days before the deadline. Only one application per applicant is accepted. In case that more than one application is submitted by the same legal entity, the most recent application will be considered.

All provided information will be treated confidentially and stored only for the purpose of this Call. The Call Announcement is available in English (the project’s working language) and the partner’s country's official language (Italian, French, Spanish, Greek and Hungarian). The call announcements will be available on the call webpage http://ecotours-project.eu and on the partners websites as reported below:

Coordinator: PRISM impresa sociale srl (Italy):

https://www.prismonline.eu/it/progetto-ecotours/

Universidade de Vigo (Spain):

https://opi.uvigo.gal/area-investigacion/proxectos/#06

Petra Patrimonia Corsica (France):

http://www.petrapatrimonia-corse.com/portfolio-items/ecotours/

ENOROS Consulting Ltd (Cyprus):

http://enoros.com.cy/en/homepage

Fondazione Comunitaria di Agrigento e Trapani (Italy):

https://fcagrigentotrapani.it/progetto/ecotours/

ANKO - West Macedonia Development Company (Greece):

https://www.anko.gr/index.php/el/ecotours.html

The Chamber of Commerce and Industry Csongrád County (Hungary):

https://csmkik.hu/oldalak/ecotours-en

The Application Form has to be filled in English.

Questions on the application process can be addressed at: ecotours@enoros.com.cy

A Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) document will be available on the open call website, and it will be regularly updated.

Quality assessment

Each project partner in the targeted country will form an Evaluation Committee consisting of three internal evaluators who will be in charge of the submitted applications. The evaluators shall have solid knowledge on topics related to sustainability, sustainable tourism, capacity building, training, and skills development and therefore their views and opinions will ensure that the most suitable candidates are selected.

The Evaluation Committee will assess each application in a transparent and fair way, respecting the confidentiality of any information identified as confidential at the time it is provided. Evaluations shall be performed applying the highest ethical and moral standards. Each Evaluator will commit by signing an Evaluator’s Confidentiality and Conflict of Interest statement. 

Ranking and final selection

The Evaluation Committee will record scores and remarks of an application on a dedicated «Evaluation Form». It will meet or communicate together to prepare the ranking list, representing opinions and scores on which the evaluators agree and which they will sign. All three members of the selection committee need to participate in the evaluation to assign a final score.

Using the overall scores for each application, the evaluators will generate a ranked list. In total 6 lists, one for each participating country will be generated. These lists will be published on the call website available at http://ecotours-project.eu and on the project partner’s website.

The applicants will be informed in writing about the evaluation results, indicatively within six weeks from the application deadline via email.

The notification can be:

o   Successful: An application has been successful in the Call.

o   Waitlisted (in reserve list): An application was successful in the Call, but it has been put in reserve list, in case one of the successful applicants does not finally participate. An unsigned version of the consensus report of the evaluation is sent.

o   Not successful: An application has not been successful in the Call. An unsigned version of the consensus report of the evaluation is sent.

Note that decisions will be published on the ECOTOURS webpage.

Applicants have the right to object to the evaluation and selection results according to the rules set in paragraph 6.7 of the Guidelines.
description:
Phase 1: MSMEs application and selection.

Potential applicants will be supported by the ECOTOURS partners. Communication initiatives will be coordinated by the WP leader FCAT so as to reach relevant stakeholders. FAQ will be managed by ENOROS and regularly published integrating the call and interpretation of specific articles as the case may be. The evaluation procedure will be set using common standards and provisions in each Country. Harmonized reports are created by PRISM and managed by all partners.

Phase 2: Project implementation 

Selected beneficiaries shall comply with the obligations set out in the Call Announcement and in the Grant Agreement. Beneficiaries must play an active role in the project by using their skills, experience, and good practice. The implementation of the projects’ activities is the sole responsibility of the beneficiary with the support of the project’s consortium.

Throughout the Grant Agreement’s duration, the beneficiaries shall comply with the following:

1.            Commit in implementing all the activities described in the section “what do we offer?” and get certified with a sustainability tool and method.

2.            Accept and follow the articles, rules and requirements of the Call and the Grant Agreement.

3.            May not transfer or assign directly or indirectly any portion of the support to other MSME’s, organisations or individuals.

4.            Provide a contact person to manage the activities, manage all responsibilities arising from the Grant Agreement and lead the communication with the ECOTOURS consortium.

5.            Provide any information requested by the ECOTOURS consortium for ensuring compliance with any written request or direction received from EISMEA concerning the proper implementation and management of the project.
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
furtherInformation:
ECOTOURS - Empowering local communities turning them into laboratories for co-development of circular and sustainable tourism ecosystems – will enhance the capacity of tourism’s MSMEs to promote circular tourism and to uptake environmental principles and standards in their businesses. ECOTOURS will promote sustainability principles and practices, use of clean energy and green transports and the recycling and reuse of materials/products along with the promotion of locally based food and craft productions. The project main objectives are:

  • To increase the capacity of tourism’s MSMEs and community ecosystems in EU to incorporate and promote sustainable strategies and practices on circular tourism;
  • To boost the transition process of tourism’s SMEs by increasing their capacity to uptake sustainable and circular principles and standards;
  • To engage key actors and local communities in Europe in cohesive and collaborative strategies and actions to build-up a support system to tourism SMEs;
  • To increase sustainability, competitiveness and economic regeneration of rural destinations in Europe through circular tourism.

ECOTOURS is coordinated by PRISM Impresa Sociale S.r.l (Italy) and supported by: CFTA Community Foundation of Agrigento and Trapani (Italy); ENOROS Consulting Ltd (Cyprus) ANKO West Macedonia Development Company (Greece); PPC Petra Patrimonia Corsica (France); CSMKIK Chamber of Commerce and Industry Csongrad-Csanad County (Hungary); UVIGO University of Vigo (Spain).

Who can apply?

The applicant must be a micro, small or medium enterprise (MSME) as defined by the Commission recommendation of 6 May 2003 concerning the definition of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (2003/361/EC): Official EU publications on MSME’s definition and explanations are available from: https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=celex%3A32003H036; https://op.europa.eu/en/publication-detail/-/publication/10abc892-251c-4d41-aa2b-7fe1ad83818c

The applicant works in one of the following categories and/or corresponding Nace codes (Based on NACE Revision 2, https://ec.europa.eu/urostat/documents/3859598/5902521/KS-RA-07- 015-EN.PDF):

●             I5510 - Hotels and similar accommodation,

●             I5520 - Holiday and other short-stay accommodation,

●             I5530 - Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks,

●             I5610 - Restaurants and mobile food service activities,

●             N79 - Travel agency, tour operator reservation service and related activities

●             N7721 - Renting and leasing of recreational and sports goods,

●             R90 - Creative, arts and entertainment activities that are demonstrating or aiming for innovation in tourism,

●             R91 - Libraries, archives, museums, and other cultural activities,

●             R93 - Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities,

●             other SMEs from the NACE code A - Agriculture, forestry and fishing that are demonstrating or aiming for innovation in tourism.

The applicant declares the main NACE code in the Application Form. The applicant’s economic activity is in tourism or other activities that are demonstrating or aiming for innovation in tourism; The applicant is located in the following eligible countries: Italy (IT); Greece (EL); France (FR); Hungary (HU); Spain (ES); Cyprus (CY). The applicant is not a company undertaking in difficulty. The applicant complies with national and EU regulations, and it has not applied or received double funding. In particular, the applicant do not have had convictions for fraudulent behavior, other financial irregularities, unethical or illegal business practices; not have been declared bankrupt or have initiated bankruptcy procedures; are not under liquidation or is not an enterprise under difficulty according to the Commission Regulation No 651/2014, art. 2.18; are not excluded from the possibility of obtaining EU funding under the provisions of both national and EU law, or by a decision of either national or EU authority.

What do we offer?

ECOTOURS offers to selected MSMEs an indicative amount of €6.650,00 covering the expenditures foreseen for following activities:

1.            Activity 1 - Consultancy and Coaching for Circular Business Development (Duration 17 months, 01/10/2023 – 28/02/2025)

2.            Activity 2 – Sustainability Consultancy and Certification (Duration 17 months, 01/10/2023 – 28/02/2025)

3.            Activity 3 – Participation at a transnational study visit

4.            Activity 4 – Support to the creation of a circular ecotourism itinerary (Duration 6 months, 01/07/2024 until 31/12/2024)

5.            Activity 5 – Design of a proposal for the innovation contest (Duration 6 months, 01/07/2024 until 31/12/2024)

Payment scheme will be as follows:

The financial support will be indicatively €6.650,00 for each beneficiary divided in three amounts. The first payment will be up to €2.000,00 and it covers activity 1 - Consultancy and Coaching for Circular Business Development. The second payment will be up to €4.000,00 for activity 2 - Sustainability Consultancy and Certification.

As for activity 3, each beneficiary will receive an amount of €650,00 for the participation of one person at an overseas transnational study visit or €350,00 for one implemented at a local level. This amount will cover traveling, accommodation, and subsistence costs (additional costs to be covered by selected beneficiaries).

Finally, the Innovation Contest foreseen will provide to the winners a total prize of €10.000,00 to jointly develop the destination management system & crowdsourcing portal to be used in local circular tourism itineraries set up, promoting their development during and beyond the project.
caName: ECOTOURS  - MSME’s support on circular tourism
projectName: Empowering local communities turning them into laboratories for co-development of circular and sustainable tourism ecosystems

results.summary: First Mile Sustainability Support Program : Open Call for tourism SMEs
results.content: First Mile Sustainability Support Program : Open Call for tourism SMEs

beneficiaryAdministration: All the information regarding the submission & evaluation process will be available on https://firstmileproject.eu.
description:
The First Mile Sustainability Support Program has been designed by First Mile experts in behavioral sciences and sustainable tourism. It includes a set of activities and services offered by First Mile to guide SMEs in their journey toward sustainability. It aims at helping them to reduce their carbon footprint and environmental impact, focusing on the following topics:

  1. Reduce waste (including single-use plastic & food waste).
  2. Reduce energy consumption (smart use of energy).
  3. Reduce water consumption (smart use of water).
  4. Encourage green mobility (smart mobility).
  5. Improve visitor flow management (smart visits).
  6. Promote local food.


Each selected SME will have access to:

  1. Top level capacity building and coaching sessions with some of the best European experts in behavioral sciences and sustainable tourism.
  2. A toolbox of more than 20 behavior-based tactics for going green.
  3. A financial support and an ongoing coaching to implement two or more behavioral tactics and to monitor its sustainability performance.
  4. Peer-to-peer learning sessions.
  5. An international visibility.
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
furtherInformation:
1. Web address: https://firstmileproject.eu.
  2. Email address: info@firstmileproject.eu.
caName: First Mile Sustainability Support Program : Open Call for tourism SMEs
projectName: Supporting tourism SMEs in walking the first mile in improving their sustainability footprint through innovative behaviour change techniques

results.summary: LookUP - THE SUSTAINABLE TOURISM TRANSFORMATION PROGRAMME ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’
results.content: LookUP - THE SUSTAINABLE TOURISM TRANSFORMATION PROGRAMME ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’

beneficiaryAdministration:
Submission:

Guide for applicants can be downloaded from the following link: https://lookupthesky.eu/

The published link leads to the call front page which lists all information and application conditions with respect to the call.

Applications to the LookUP Open Call shall be submitted through the submission platform at the LookUP website to the following web address: https://lookupthesky.eu/ .

SMEs of the tourism sector can apply to receive financial support. Companies shall meet the following criteria to be eligible:

  1. You are an SME: Comply with the European Commission Recommendation 2003/361/EC defining the criteria to qualify as a small and medium enterprise (SME).  
  2. Be active in the hospitality and tourism sectors: Your economic activity is related and preferably registered under the following business activities:  

-Hotels and similar accommodation (NACE I5510)

-Holiday and other short-stay accommodation (NACE I5520)

-Restaurants and mobile food service activities (NACE I5610)

-Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks (NACE I5530)

-Travel agency, tour operator reservation service and related activities (NACE N79)

  1. Be established in one of the eligible countries: Finland, Spain, and Romania.
  2. Other:

-You must apply individually. It is not permitted to propose projects in partnership with other enterprises.

-You can only submit one application.

-Your enterprise has not received financial support under other projects from the Call for proposals SMP-COSME-2021-TOURSME: I-STARS, CE4RT, STAR GROWTH, COASTOUR, TRACE, FIRST MILE, ETSM 2030, SUSRUR and ECOTOURS.

-Your enterprise has not been declared bankrupt or has initiated bankruptcy procedures.

-Your enterprise has not had convictions for fraudulent behaviour, other financial irregularities, unethical or illegal business practices.

-Your enterprise is not under liquidation or an enterprise under difficulty accordingly to the Commission Regulation No 651/2014 art. 2.18.

-Your enterprise is not excluded from the possibility of obtaining EU funding under the provisions of both national and EU law, or by a decision of either national or EU authority.

Evaluation Process:

There will be at least 100 SMEs selected for Window 1 and at least 60 SMEs for Window 2.

  1.  The application will be judged against the Award criteria (Annex II):

 -Excellence (50%; 1-10 rating score): Relevance to the tourism sector and territory targeted by the project, strategic fit between the challenge or opportunity tackled and the organisation; Innovative character of the solution proposed (only assessed for Window 2)

-Impact (20%; 1-10 rating score): Positive broader impact on various stakeholders, such as tourists, local communities, the environment, and the tourism industry. Scale up potential in other areas/sectors; Contribution to the goals of the LookUP project.

-Company and Capability (20%; 1-10 rating score): Capability and experience of the company or team behind the preliminary business idea, considering their track record, relevant skills, expertise, and available resources; Motivation and commitment of the company or team to further develop and execute the business idea successfully.

-Cost-effectiveness (10%; 1-10 rating score): Best value for money.

  1.  At the end of the evaluation process, all applications will be ranked based on a set of rules (Annex III of the Call guidelines). It is important to note that the number of applications selected will be at least 20 applications per each individual country, and for that reason, applications will be ranked in country-based ranking lists. The remaining 40 (up to 100 to reach the target for this Window) will be ranked based on a general ranking (with all the applications from the three countries mixed). The rest will be part of the reserve list.

The best 60 applications will be selected as ‘top innovators’, receiving financial support for the first stage of Window 2 (co-innovation).
description:
This call is composed by:

  1. Window 1 SUSTAINABILITY, supporting the sustainability of tourism enterprises: The Programme will select at least 100 enterprises to receive financial support to foster their ‘Go Green’ transition.
  2. Window 2 INNOVATION, fostering innovation capacities of tourism enterprises: The Programme will offer further financial support to a selection of at least 60 enterprises, which will have the opportunity to follow the ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’. This Window is divided in three stages: Stage 2.1 Co-innovation, Stage 2.2 Business Plan and Stage 2.3 Showcase.


Window 1: Sustainability [4.500 EUR Lump sum]

Eligible costs: For mentoring and consultancy services, and/or the cost of a certified training for the preparation for labels and certifications, environmental assessments, training for workforce, etc.

Window 2: Innovation

Stage 2.1: Co-innovation [1.500 EUR Lump sum]

Eligible costs: Traveling costs to Kuusamo (Finland) to participate in a co-innovation event and study visit. Lump sum reduced to 300 EUR if a SME comes from the same country (Finland)

Outcome: Preliminary innovative business idea

Stage 2.2: Business Plan [2.500 EUR Lump sum]

Eligible costs: Mentorship and consultancy, as well as for traveling costs to Extremadura (Spain) to participate in a business plan development workshop and study visit. Lump sum reduced to 1.800 EUR if a SME comes from the same country (Spain).

Outcome: Business Plan

Stage 2.3: Showcase [1.000 EUR Lump sum]

Eligible costs: For traveling costs to Sibiu (Romania) to participate in a business showcase and study visit. Lump sum reduced to 300 EUR if a SME comes from the same country (Romania).
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
duration: 12 months (the exact date and duration will depend on the window and stages involved).
furtherInformation:
LookUP rolls out an acceleration programme, the so-called Sustainable Transformation Programme to support tourism enterprises to ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’ (Triple Transition).

As explained in the next section, the call is composed by two Windows: Window 1: Sustainability and Window 2:Innovation. The SMEs may join both or choose just one of them.

The call includes:

1) maximum 8.800 EUR in financial support;

2) training and mentoring;

3) participation in events to build networking and professional links.

The objective of the Programme is to increase the competitiveness of tourism enterprises by promoting sustainability strategies and innovations in tourism linked with the preservation of natural heritage and biodiversity, and the development of rural tourism and ecotourism, with particular attention to slow tourism activities that can be undertaken across seasons.

Open call benefits:

  1. Financial support: Financial support up to a maximum of 8.800 EUR if you go through all the stages.
  2. Tailored training and mentoring: Tailor-made training and mentoring to participants on green, digital, and business skills offered through the Triple Transition for Tourism Training programme developed by LookUP; Comprehensive set of practical toolkits designed for you under the ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’ Toolbox
  3. Networking and community: Events focused on innovation, as well as an online community that includes tourism professionals from around Europe. 
  4. Good practices’ inspiration: Resources such as the ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’ Playbook developed by LookUP; On-site study visits to explore ‘the sky as destination’ good practices organised in Kuusamo (Finland), Extremadura (Spain) and Sibiu (Romania).
  5. Monitoring Framework: A digital tool designed to help you track your sustainability progress. The monitoring framework will assist you in reporting data on selected Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and then compare values between different reporting sessions.
caName: LookUP - THE SUSTAINABLE TOURISM TRANSFORMATION PROGRAMME ‘Go Green, Get Digital and Be Resilient’
projectName: Supporting Tourism SMEs Triple Transition by Uncovering the Value of Sky as Destination

results.summary: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 – ETSM2030
results.content: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 – ETSM2030

beneficiaryAdministration:
Submission process

Interested applicants, represented by legal representatives of tourism SMEs, are requested to apply online and answer all mandatory questions at: www.etsm2030.eu/apply link.

Questions on the application process can be addressed at: etsm2030@uibk.ac.at

 

How to apply

Who can apply - Eligibility Criteria

Any legal entity that fulfils the following conditions is allowed to submit its application for funding under the call:

1.1.  Be a small or medium-sized enterprise (SME) as defined by the EU recommendation 2003/3612;

In this sense, start-ups, micro, small and medium-sized enterprises, same as any other type of SME falling under this definition are eligible to apply to the call.

1.2.  Be registered in one of the participating EU-member countries of ETSM2030 partnership:

  • Austria, Germany, Italy, Poland, Romania, Slovenia.

1.3.  Be established for at least three financial years to be proved through the Company Registration Report;

1.4.  Work in tourism, i. e. belong to one of these categories of the tourism industry (NACE classes and categories):

  • H4910 — Passenger rail transport, interurban
  • H4932 — Taxi operation
  • H4939 — Other passenger land transport n.e.c.
  • H5010 — Sea and coastal passenger water transport
  • H5030 — Inland passenger water transport
  • H5110 — Passenger air transport
  • I5510 — Hotels and similar accommodation
  • I5520 — Holiday and other short-stay accommodation
  • I5530 — Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks
  • I5610 — Restaurants and mobile food service activities
  • I5630 — Beverage serving activities
  • N7710 — Renting and leasing of motor vehicles
  • N7721 — Renting and leasing of recreational and sports goods
  • N79 —    Travel agency, tour operator reservation service and related activities
  • N8230 – Organisation of conventions and trade shows
  • R90 —     Creative, arts and entertainment activities
  • R91 —     Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural activities
  • R92 —     Gambling and betting activities
  • R93 —     Sports activities and amusement and recreation activities


It is also a prerequisite that the applicants fulfil the following criteria:

1.5.  Has not been declared bankrupt or has initiated bankruptcy procedures;

1.6.  Be not under liquidation; an enterprise under difficulty accordingly to the Commission Regulation No 651/2014 art. 2.18.

1.7.  Conducts activities that respect climate and environmental priorities of the EU and cause no significant harm to them [reference to EU horizontal principle].

 All applicants must apply individually. It is not permitted to propose projects in partnership with other SMTEs. Only one application per SMTE is accepted.

Applying SMTEs have to agree to the Declaration of Honor, where the applying SMTE has to declare that it is not in any of the above-mentioned situations. Selected SMTEs have to sign the Service Agreement which defines eligible activities for both parties within 3 weeks after acceptance notification. If a selected SMTE fails to sign the service agreement it will be put on the reserve list.

 

Application procedure

All applicants are requested to:

  • Apply online through the dedicated page (https://www.etsm2030.eu/). Applicants shall register on the platform to access the ETSM2030 call for proposals page and the application package.
  • Applying SMTEs have to fill in an application in the English language. Due to the fact that applicants would be non-native English speakers, the applications will not be evaluated based on the use of language but on the provided content. Please be clear and precise in the explanations provided in the project proposal.
  • Fill in the administrative and technical information requested in the online AF on the platform.
  • Complete the online application and submit all the documents requested. Applicants who fail to do so will not be considered admissible.

Proposals are admissible only if they meet the following criteria:

  • Only one application per applicant can be submitted for this Call for Proposals. In the case of submissions by the same applicant of different proposals or multiple submissions of the same proposal, only the last one received will enter the evaluation process; the rest will be declared as non-admissible.
  • Only proposals submitted before the deadline will be accepted. The deadline for this call is Wednesday 5 July 2023, at 17:00 CET (Brussels time).
  • Only complete proposals, including all the required information and documentation, will be accepted.
  • Only proposals submitted through the online submission form will be accepted. Paper/printed versions or hand-written versions submitted by post or other means will not be accepted.

The call for proposals will be open from Wednesday 3 May 2023 to Wednesday 5 July 2023 at 17:00 CET (Brussels time). Applications submitted after the deadline will not be accepted and will receive by return e-mail a "call closed" message. Potential applicants are invited not to wait until the last moment to apply. The time of receipt of the application, as recorded by the submission system, will be definite.

 

Evaluation and selection process

An independent Selection and Evaluation Committee will manage and supervise the process, ensuring fairness and transparency. The evaluators will generate a ranked list using the overall scores for each application.

The evaluation will happen in the following way:

  • Formal eligibility check of proposals
  • Technical evaluation with appointed experts
  • Selection procedure

 

Check for Proposal Eligibility

Before proposals are evaluated technically, their administrative eligibility is verified. Only eligible submissions will be evaluated. The eligibility criteria, as referred to in section 3 of the call text, will be applied to discard non-eligible proposals.

Non-eligible proposals will get a rejection letter with the proper decision justification.

 

Evaluation criteria

Eligible applications will be evaluated against predetermined evaluation criteria, applying predefined score points. These criteria are listed in section 4.2. of the call and will be applied to discard non- eligible proposals.

 The applicants will be requested to explain their sustainability monitoring needs/status quo in terms of:

  • sustainability practices,
  • willingness to implement cutting-edge developments,
  • ability to network with other stakeholders in their destinations and their influence on other members of the ecosystem.

Moreover, the applicants shall explain how the training and advisory support and joint international sustainable innovation projects (SIP) will meet their needs and will support them in the process of recovery after COVID-19.

For each criterion marks from 0–5 points are given, which means that the maximum score is 15 points. Those proposals which pass the threshold of 5 points are included in the further evaluation process while those with lower than 5 points are rejected. Although passing the threshold does not mean that the project will be funded. The ranking is separately listed for each individual territory.

 

Selection of the participating SMTEs

Applying SMTEs will be selected based on the scores achieved in the Evaluation Form. The selection committee consists of four industry experts and two scientific experts in sustainable management and monitoring. One of the four industry experts is located in the respective country of the SMTE.

Ranking of proposals based on SMTEs overall score: max. 15 points to achieve.

Six national rankings will be made to maintain the geographical variety of SMTEs. In case of the same SMTEs’ score and position in the ranking, the following priority rule will be used:

(1) the score in C2 Willingness to implement cutting-edge developments,

(2) the score in C3 Ability to network

and (3) the score in C1 Sustainability practices

One month after closing the call each applicant will be informed via e-mail of the (1) acceptance, (2) inclusion in the reserve ranking list or (3) rejection of the application Moreover, the name of selected SMTEs will be published at the ETSM2030 website.

For each country reserve ranking lists will be made in the case of any withdrawals reported by the selected SMTEs.
description:
ETSM2030 offers a bundle of eligible activities for which financial support is provided and direct services to the SMTEs provided by the project consortium. These tailored services will be delivered as follows:

Step 1 - Open Call: The application process for 84 SMTEs from 6 different countries starts.

Step 2 – Selection of SMTES: Our expert-team will select the participating SMTEs.

Step 3 – Assessment of the Status Quo: Asessing the current Status Quo of sustainability awareness, practices and monitoring within the SMTEs (see eligible activity 1, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 4 – Knowledge Improvement: With coachings and trainings about sustainability the SMTEs will improve their knowledge (see eligible activity 2, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 5 – Sustainability Monitoring Tools: SMTEs will develop a sustainability monitoring tool which is suitable for SMTEs and can easily be integrated in daily routines.

Step 6 – Sustainability Innovation Projects: Together with other SMTEs of ETSM2023 joint projects in the field of sustainability will be conducted (see eligible activity 3, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 7 – Application for Certification: SMTEs will develop and apply for a sustainability certification (see eligible activity, section 2.3 in the call)

Step 8 - SESTINE: The SESTINE is a network for fostering exchange between sustainable working SMTEs.
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
furtherInformation:
European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 - in short 'ETSM2030' - is a project co-funded by the European Union under the Single Market Programme, supporting the sustainability activity of European small and medium-sized tourism enterprises. The Call for Proposals sets out the rules for submission and selection of third parties (SMTEs) that will receive financial support under the project.

The project is run by the international consortium created by the following partners representing six European countries:

  • University of Innsbruck (Austria),
  • IMC Krems (Austria),
  • Centre of Business Excellence (CBE) (Slovenia),
  • Eurac Research (Italy),
  • Poznań University of Economics and Business (Poland),
  • RoMontana, National Association for Rural and Mountain Development (Romania),
  • TourCert (Germany),
  • and TVB Innsbruck (Austria).

 

Project objectives

Objective 1: Creating a long-term monitoring system for tourism SMTEs

Objective 2: Initiating effective mechanisms for best practice exchange

Objective 3: Fostering innovative solutions and creating awareness

Objective 4: Creating inter-regional digital eco-systems of sustainability innovation

Objective 5: Creating support for tourism SMTEs in developing their skills and capacities

 

What do we offer?

The selected SMEs go through four eligible activities for which they receive financial support in the form of lump sums in the amount of € 7.840,-. The eligible activities are:

  • Eligible Activity 1: sustainability monitoring
  • Eligible Activity 2: training/ coaching
  • Eligible Activity 3: sustainability innovations
  • Eligible Activity 4: certification application

 

For further information see section 2.3. in the call.
caName: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030 – ETSM2030
projectName: European Tourism Sustainability Monitoring 2030

results.summary: INNOVATE call for supporting SMEs in the tourism sector
results.content: INNOVATE call for supporting SMEs in the tourism sector

beneficiaryAdministration:
1. Submission Process:


Apply online via F6S Submission System: https://www.f6s.com/susrur-open-call-2/apply


IMPORTANT: Documents to be submitted during the Sub-grant Agreement stage if your application is selected:


  1. Declaration of Honour
  2. SME Status Checklist (if applicable)
  3. Other documents that can assist the Open Call Manager during the eligibility process


The documentation kit of this call, which contains all its documents, is available at https://susrur.eu/calls-for-proposal/open-call-2-innovate 


Personal data privacy will be managed according to article 4.5 Data protection of the Call for Proposals and Guide of Applicants

(https://drive.google.com/file/d/19WAFA4a4VjEQTpw6Rhqq1YvvWR_KdW2i/view).


Any further questions regarding the application process should be addressed at contact@susrur.eu


2. Evaluation Process:


Applications will be reviewed by internal experts part of the SUSRUR consortium, with proven expertise in the field. Applications will be sorted and selected through the following three main phases:


  1. Admissibility and Eligibility check
  2. Proposal evaluation
  3. Ranking and final selection.


Applicants must:


  1. outline the relevance of selected Good Sustainable Practices for improving their tourism business sustainability
  2. envisage a well-structured plan for potential Good Sustainable Practices replication
  3. showcase a strategic alignment of consulting topics and available certification schemes with digital and green transition
  4. highlight that team members are well-positioned for successful implementation of the project
  5. showcase the benefits and impacts of replicating and implementing good practices for business development (economic, technological, environmental, and societal levels) and project contributions to regional sustainability (social, environmental, and economic aspects).


The evaluation process will be conducted remotely. At the end of the evaluation process, applications will be ranked considering the final score. Evaluation criteria is described in article 5 of the Guide for Applicant 

(https://drive.google.com/file/d/19WAFA4a4VjEQTpw6Rhqq1YvvWR_KdW2i/view). 


Applicants will be informed of the decision related to their applications within two months upon deadline via dedicated email. 


The final list of funded third parties will also be published on SUSRUR website.
description:
During the implementation of the Innovate Programme, applicants are expected to implement and be enrolled in several activities. Below the overall programme provided under SUSRUR Open Call #2 is briefly presented.


A) Replication of Good Sustainable Practices


The replication of Good Sustainable Practices aims to promote the learning, replication and setup of good sustainable practices from the five regions of the SURUR project by applicants. A booklet with a pre-selection list of good sustainable practices (to ensure its alignment with the project objectives) will be available and focus on six categories: 1) circular economy; 2) clean energy transition; 3) digitalization; 4) smart mobility; 5) biodiversity; and, 6) other.


The replication of the Good Sustainable Practice will consist on the following activities:


  1. Study visit to three selected regional GPs


Selected applicants must select three good sustainable practices from one region (different from the applicant) to perform a transnational study visit based on peer-to-peer learning and good practice exchange on sustainable tourism, facilitating the matchmaking and cooperation between rural tourism SMEs and showcasing tourism business with good practices in sustainability. After completion of the study visit, the SME must select one of the good sustainable practices in order to replicate in their business.


  1. Study visit of GP provider to applicant premises


A second transnational study visit must be completed by the selected good sustainable practices provider to the third party to support and contribute for an adequate replication and implementation of the good sustainable practices.

B) Training sessions focused on sustainable and innovative practices


Training sessions will focus on the development of sustainability skills throughout individual growth paths with a relevant impact on the SMEs business performance and capacity building activities in order to empower the rural tourism SMEs towards digital and green transition.


C) Access to specialised consulting services


Through the access to specialised consulting services, applicants will have at their disposal a range of specialised services from business analysis or/and guidance to develop key competences in digital tools, marketing, sustainability, resilience and economics. Available services in the Innovate Programme will focus on the topics listed below:

 

  1. Digital Marketing Plan
  2. Sustainability and Strategy Plan
  3. Technology and innovation survey


D) Implementation of Sustainable Tourism Certification Schemes & Labels (OPTIONAL)


Implementation of Sustainable Tourism Certification Schemes & Labels will promote the incorporation of a sustainable tourism label or certificate with the long-term goal of contributing to boost the customer trust towards the SMEs and to embed sustainable activities on their core business values. This will lead to improvement of the SMEs performance through more efficient management, economic benefits, softer paperwork in public administration, or enhanced image towards the public, among others.
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
furtherInformation:
Up to 80 SMEs from eligible regions will be supported by SUSRUR Open Call #2 - INNOVATE.


SUSRUR project (GA nº101085887) was launched in January 2023 to address the inherent challenges for Tourism SMEs from 5 European rural and remote areas by promoting an open call to help awarded applicants to develop their sustainability and innovative practices and strategies while providing tools and skills to strengthen their competitiveness in a post-COVID-19 scenario.


SUSRUR main goal is to provide a networking and support platform to tourism SMEs in rural and remote/mountain areas to enhance the awarded applicants sustainability practices, productivity, competitiveness and innovation capacity, promoting innovative technologies, services and business models and boosting their capacity and skills to embrace the twin digital-green transition.


What do we offer?


In the nutshell, advantages of participating in SUSRUR Open Call #2 are as follows:


  1. Implement an innovative 12-month project to improve your sustainability performance towards green and digital transition
  2. Obtain credibility and recognition from an EU project
  3. Receive up to 7,000 € lump sum funding (equity free)
  4. Develop new skills, and replicate and implement innovative solutions
  5. Access to consulting services
  6. Initiate a certification scheme/ label (OPTIONAL)
  7. Networking opportunities within your region and other eligible regions

 

Financial Support


Total funding per applicant is up to 7.000,00 € (lump sum).


Payments will be made in three installments upon completion of defined checkpoints (article 2.3 Payment schedule of the Guide for Applicants

https://drive.google.com/file/d/19WAFA4a4VjEQTpw6Rhqq1YvvWR_KdW2i/view). 

Payment release will depend on the completion of each checkpoint upon approval by the Open Call Manager. 


Payment will be proceeded as follows:


  1. 1800 EUR upon signature of the Sub-Grant Agreement
  2. 2100 EUR upon completion of checkpoints 1 and 2
  3. 2100 EUR upon completion of checkpoints 3 and 4
  4. 1000 EUR upon completion of checkpoint 5 (OPTIONAL)


Applicants must guarantee that the Financial Support to Third Parties is used to complete the supporting activities.

results.summary: SMEs TRAnsition for an European Circular tourism Ecosystem: TRACE 2nd OPEN CALL FOR SMEs SUPPORT IN BELGIUM AND SPAIN
results.content: SMEs TRAnsition for an European Circular tourism Ecosystem: TRACE 2nd OPEN CALL FOR SMEs SUPPORT IN BELGIUM AND SPAIN

beneficiaryAdministration:
Submission process

Interested applicants from the two eligible countries (Belgium and Spain), represented by legal representatives of tourism SMEs, are requested to apply online and answer all mandatory questions at: TRACE Application Form link.

Applications are submitted by the SMEs on the EU Survey platform which include questions related to the TRACE programme and specific acknowledgment to the conditions of the programme.

EUSurvey platform will be the entry point for all proposals that will be submitted to TRACE programme.

Questions on the application process can be addressed at: support@iniziativa.cc

The open call guidelines can be downloaded at the following link https://www.ispc.cnr.it/en/2023/02/21/trace/


Evaluation process

The applications will be collected, analysed and assessed by an Evaluation Board composed of TRACE Consortium members. Applications will be sorted and selected following three main steps:

1 - Admissibility and Eligibility check

2 - Proposal evaluation

3 - Ranking and final selection.


It is important to note that if admissibility/eligibility criteria will be met and if applications will reach the threshold of 9/15 in the score, early registrants will receive priority consideration for program selection on the basis of the ‘first come, first served’ approach. A prompt registration ensures a higher likelihood of being among the first cohort selected for the TRACE Support Programme.


An application will be eligible only is all the following eligibility criteria are met:

1. proposals must be compliant with all eligibility criteria set in Section 2.2 of the Open Call;

2. each SME may submit only one (1) proposal. In case an SME submits more than one proposal, only the last application will be accepted;

3. the SMEs that participated in the Open Call and were not selected for the funding support, will be qualified to participate for free within TRACE programme to benefit of capacity building and networking activities.


A manual filtering process will be used to discard ineligible proposals. The admissibility/eligibility criteria check will verify:

1. The proposal was submitted before the call deadline electronically via EUSurvey portal [Y/N]

2. The proposal is complete and contain all the requested information in the Application Form [Y/N]

3. The proposal is written in the English language [Y/N]

4. The applicant is a legal entity established in the eligible countries described in Section 2.2 [Y/N]

5. The applicant is an SME as defined in Section 2.2. [Y/N]

6. The applicant SME is operating in the tourism sector as described in Section 2.2. [Y/N]


A Proposal is admissible/eligible if all answers to the previous criteria are Yes.

A team of experts of TRACE project will be defined to evaluate the applications: two (2) experts will evaluate remotely the proposals and will assign individual and final scoring.

Applicants must demonstrate:

1. a clear set of objectives aligned with the definition of the TRACE goals and with the general objectives of the project;

2. the expected outcomes and impacts of the TRACE support programme and its contribution to SME circular development;

3. credible evidence that the project team is committed to learn/ grow and has the necessary skills and management experience to be able to implement the circular economy transition.


At the end of the evaluation process all applications will be ranked in 2 country-based lists (refer to list of eligible countries in Section 2.2). The criteria for the ranking are described in the Section 4.3 of the Open Call.

The applicants will be informed about the decision made by the Evaluation Board by the end of May 2024 via email.

The final decision will also be published on TRACE project web page.
description:
TRACE tailored services will be delivered as follows:

Phase 1: Capacity Building Support (at least 100 SMEs including those of Phase 2). The aim of the activities under Phase 1 is to strengthen the capacity of the involved tourism SMEs to add value to modern business and society. TRACE Consortium will provide the SMEs with tools and methodologies aimed at recognizing and maximizing opportunities for tourism while putting sustainability, circularity, regeneration and positive societal impacts at the core of their business models. The main objectives are: enhancing skills and capacities of selected SMEs through action-learning training, workshops & peer learning; raise awareness and inspire SMEs through study visits & awareness raising activities; establish new cooperation activities of involved tourism SMEs through matchmaking, knowledge sharing, and best practices exchange.

Phase 2: Assess & Recommend. The involved tourism SMEs will be provided with a self-assessment questionnaire in order to map and assess their needs and challenges towards sustainable and circular tourism. Based on the self-assessment feedback, training, peer learning and knowledge exchange under Phase 1, the involved SMEs will be able, also with the support of the Trace mentoring programme, to develop their Sustainability Plan.

Phase 3: Circular Business Direct Support (at least 30 SMEs). SMEs will be supported in order to enhance sustainability strategies and practices related to circular and sustainable tourism, providing direct support to 30 individual tourism SMEs selected between those participating Phase 1 and Phase 2 activities. Direct support will be provided with a focus on the environmental assessments and certifications towards circular and sustainable tourism; and strategic business development for sustainability and circularity, including business modelling, business planning, and investment strategies to enhance sustainability, resilience, cooperation and competitiveness of the SMEs.

Phase 4: Direct Funding (100 SMEs 20 SMEs per each eligible country). Beneficiaries will be awarded with direct funding of maximum EUR 7,200 to deploy their Sustainability Plan.
title: COVID-19 Recovery Through Sustainable Tourism Growth and SME Support
furtherInformation:
‘SMEs TRAnsition for an European Circular tourism Ecosystem’ project – in short ‘TRACE’ – is a project co-funded by the European Commission under the Single Market Programme (SMP SMP/SME Pillar), which aims to provide sustainability services such as strategies, training activities and tools for tourism SMEs willing to innovate their business models and enhance their performance from a sustainability and circularity perspective (https://www.ispc.cnr.it/en/2023/02/21/trace/).

The TRACE Support Programme will involve directly SMEs that will be projected to become “champions” of sustainability and inspire other micro and small-sized enterprises in their local contexts.

Activities will focus on sustainability aspects such as analysis of Greenhouse Gases (GHG) emissions, development of sustainability plans, support for application to EU eco-label and other certification processes, and monitoring of a set of key indicators for the level of sustainability and circularity. Particular attention will be given to the enhancement of skills and capacities of the involved SMEs internal staff, through training and capacity building activities, and a series of direct support services dedicated to certification processes, sustainable finance and innovation management. Thus, the whole TRACE Support Programme aims at supporting tourism SMEs in taking their first steps towards the sustainability journey, starting a process which has a large potential to bring benefits not only to the single enterprise but to the entire territory/society.

The seven partner that constitute the consortium are based in five different countries:

· CNR – Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche (Italy);

· Haute Ecole ICHEC – ECAM – ISFSC (Belgium);

· Iniziativa Cure S.r.l. (Italy);

· ADR - Agentia Pentru Dezvoltare Regionala Nord-Est (Romania);

· ANETEL - Anaptyxiaki Etaireia Eparchion Larnakas – Ammochostou Ltd (Cyprus);

· ATP Basilicata - Agenzia di Promozione Territoriale della Basilicata (Italy);

· Diputacion Provincial de Teruel (Spain).

 

Who can apply?

As described in Section 2.2.6 of the Open Call, the applicants must:

1. be a Small and Medium-sized Enterprise (SME):

a. An SME will be considered as such if complying with the European Commission Recommendation 2003/361/EC and the SME qualification guide;

b. SMEs that do not have yet annual turnover or balance sheets are also considered eligible given that they fulfil the mentioned criteria of the SME definition;

c. In case an SME enters the TRACE Support Programme, it will remain eligible even if, at a certain point during the programme execution, it does not fulfil criteria of the SME definition;

2. be SMEs working in tourism sector, ideally demonstrating or aiming for innovation in tourism, preferably within the following categories, in line with these Eurostat classes[1]:        

- I5510 — Hotels and similar accommodation

- I5520 — Holiday and other short-stay accommodation

- I5530 — Camping grounds, recreational vehicle parks and trailer parks

- I5610 — Restaurants and mobile food service activities

- I5630 — Beverage serving activities

- N7710 — Renting and leasing of motor vehicles

- N7721 — Renting and leasing of recreational and sports goods

- SMEs in other sectors (e.g., R - arts, entertainment and recreation) can take part in the selection process, while they need to demonstrate that their activities are linked to the tourism sector

3. be a legal entity established in one of the following countries:

- Belgium

- Spain

- Applicants that are legal entity SMEs established and based in the other European Union or EU Associated Countries[2] are eligible to participate in TRACE Support Programme (e.g., action-learning trainings, awareness raising towards sustainability and circular tourism webinars, networking activities etc.) but are excluded from receiving funding support;

4. not have had convictions for fraudulent behaviour, other financial irregularities, unethical or illegal business practices;

5. not have been declared bankrupt or have initiated bankruptcy procedures;

6. are not under liquidation or is not an enterprise under difficulty according to the Commission Regulation No 651/2014, art. 2.18;

7. are not excluded from the possibility of obtaining EU funding under the provisions of both national and EU law, or by a decision of either national or EU authority.

 

What do we offer?

The services support under TRACE Support Programme for tourism SMEs will be delivered by the TRACE Consortium members and are divided in three interconnected phases, the Phase 1: Capacity Building Support, the Phase 2: Assess & Recommend and the Phase 3: Circular Business Direct Support. The support within Phase 1, Phase 2 and Phase 3 for SMEs provided by TRACE Consortium members under the form of services are valued approximately EUR 4,000 per SME. In addition to these services provided by the Consortium, within Phase 4 beneficiaries will be awarded with direct funding in the form of grants of maximum EUR 7,200 to deploy their Sustainability Plan.

The Financial Support programme (Phase 4) is expected to start in June 2024 and close in December 2024 and will last 7 months for the beneficiary SMEs in this timespan.

The granted SMEs will be called to deliver Inception and Final reports where they will describe respectively the services to be acquired and their results. The costs must be incurred within the duration of the Financial Support programme.

The Inception report is due by the end of month 1 from the start of the Financial Support programme.

The Final report is due within 30 calendar days after the end of the Financial Support programme. Monitoring of the progress of the Financial Support programme implementation will be made at mid-term and at programme closure.

Payments will be made after positive assessment of the reports. The Consortium commits to evaluate all reports within one month of delivery and complete payment procedures within three weeks after the acceptance of the report.

Payment scheme will be as follows:

· 40% as pre-financing after contract signature and submission of the Inception report;

· 60% as final payment after the acceptance of the Final report and costs incurred.


[1]https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php?title=Tourism_industries_-_employment#Data_sources

[2] https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/smp/guidance/list-3rd-country-participation_smp_en.pdf
